Description: Solid-cast copper alloy figure of an Apis Bull wearing the sun-disc and uraeus; inlaid silver triangle on the forehead; eyes inlaid; incised necklet; vulture on the back; elaborate saddle-cloth; scarab on the rump; two tangs beneath the base.
Curator's comments: Toros Bulls: Image and Cult in the Ancient Mediterranean, Barcelona, 2003, pp.257, 312 [12] = The Bull in the Mediterranean World, Athens 2003, pp.156 - 157 [12].
Bibliographic references: Barcelona 2002 / The Bull in the Mediterranean World (cat.12, p.156)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: Exhibition: "The Bull in the Ancient World / Bulls: Image and Cult in the ancient Mediterranean", Salo del Tinell, Barcelona, 14 Nov 2002-13 Feb 2003; then Benaki Museum, Athens, 14 Nov 2002-7 Jun 2003.
